abstract: The founder of the Galleon Group pleaded not guilty to insider-trading charges in federal court and was questioned about a possible conflict at the law firm he hired.

lead_paragraph: 7:05 p.m. | Updated Almost a year to the day after agents from the Federal Bureau of Investigation arrested him on insider-trading charges, the hedge fund manager Raj Rajaratnam took the witness stand at a pretrial hearing in federal district court on Monday, raised his right hand and swore to the tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth.
